text.section: Before the commissioner shall revoke, suspend, or refuse to renew the license of any premium finance company, he or she shall give to the person an opportunity for a hearing to be conducted in accordance with KRS Chapter 13B. In lieu of or in addition to revoking or suspending the license for any of the causes enumerated in the section, after hearing as provided in this subsection, the commissioner may subject the company to a penalty specified in Subtitle 99 of this chapter when the commissioner determines that the public interest would not be harmed by the continued operation of the company. The amount of any penalty shall be paid by the company through the department of the commissioner to the State Treasurer.

If any applicant or licensee is aggrieved by any final order of the commissioner, the applicant or licensee shall have the right to appeal to the Franklin Circuit Court in accordance with KRS Chapter 13B.
